content: Reducing 1 star. So buggy...you literally lose at times because the app is broken. Opposite of fun Buggy and frustrating. Pure garbage how sometimes you can't click on a tile. Game also locks up
I really like this game, but the new update was pretty bad. I can't click on any of the spaces in the top left corner. I also preferred a vertical screen option.

Updated gui half-fixes the tiny buttons on modern phones problem. Lacks the upright orientation/portrait mode used for single-player games and forces multiplayer mode. Doesn't add missing features like undo, and it doesn't fix the "hexes in the top-left corner of the map cannot be selected" problem. It also no longer retains your game settings. The lost functionality makes this an overall disappointing update if we don't see some further improvements.

I really enjoyed the board game. Unfortunately this implementation was very disappointing. The lack of an undo function paired with the very small graphics makes it unplayable. also I don't quite get why in landscape orientation text is still displayed as if in portrait orientation. Is I could I would give it back.

I enjoy the game. The update is not an improvement. Resolution of the board on screen is less. The touch screen does not work as well as before. I miss that the game does not keep track of wins. I find that I play less without it. Why update to make the game less playable? If this is a step back in order to take two forward, that would be fine. But who knows when or even if there will a a next update.
What happened to portrait mode, very frustrating
The game had a few bugs. The recent update just made the game worse. Inaccurate touch, noise when sound if off. Going to try to roll it back or uninstall

Update is horrible, got rid of portrait mode for some unknown reason, makes it impossible to play one handed, total loss of functionality, and still no Undo. I played this game happily for years until a month ago. Will probably uninstall at this point.
Yes howevee i wish it was in english kimda suks tht its translated in germany

Great app. Love the game. One of my favorite binge-able game apps. I would love to see the expansions added. With The newest update doesn't allow all sounds to be turned off. Otherwise has absolutely been a 5 star app.
Update is a rollback, many features removed, graphics pathetic. I am about to uninstall and will never again use an app from this provider

The new update broke years of enjoyed plays. I hate when someone "updates" something that just breaks what was good. Delayed touch responses...inaccurate touch recognition...just terrible programming and quality control. Feels like an alpha release of garbage coding.
I can't figure out how to join a game with a friend online. Very difficult to navigate.
Good layout, I'm playing everything week. Love it
Couple buggy hexes, otherwise great

Love love love the game. But... The controls of this game are awful and confusing, and there seems to be no way of undoing an action, so if you have fat fingers and tap the wrong place you're hooped. Ruins the game
App does not provide online Games though stated

It needs expansions, an undo option of some kind, and a color choice function cuz I NEED to be red :( Also it's really buggy! There's one bug in particular that's driving me insane. No matter how many times I tap a piece it brings up the information window for location tiles instead.
Love the game itself. The app crashes about half the time : (
Love this board game and the app is just as good. 1 issue: there's no back button in case you misplace your piece. Will you ever make any of the expansions available?
Broken. Every game I only get two types of terrian cards
Terrible. Mistakenly added a human player and was unable to cancel the game. It would let me confirm canceling. Some elements don't scale properly, what a mess.
Lately freezes solid during most games. Shame.
This game is very easy and fun.
Nice implementation of the board game in the digital world
Good game.To the developer if u planning new boardgame app for mobile phone.could u consider Suburbia Pandemic K2 or powergrid.thanks.
it would be good to have the expansions available. the sound on/off is always on when reentering the game, i don't want to have to always check my audio settings before opening
Decent boardgame, trash app. No undo and no saving games. Developers will never bother fixing it.. 癸

need to fix the upper left corner tile. I cannot place any settlement there and I always avoid placing settlements there just to finish the game. Sometimes, AI stops in its turn then I have to cancle the gameby clicking the exit button or back button. And when asked if I will cancel, the check and x buttons do not function so I have to close the app and restart again. Great game but functionality of this application needs a lot of update.
needs undo
Fun game...super buggy on my pixel
update: changed the resolution to low. i can now see and click the buttons. will try it out for a possible 5 star rating

Slightly flawed digital implementation of a superb board game. Corner spaces are often difficult or impossible to place on. There is no undo feature, so if you misclick a space you can really screw yourself. Multiplayer is a chore to get working.

I've owned this app for a few years and its really quite a good one. Thing is they made a bunch of expansions for the board game so...where are they for the app? That's all that is keeping this from 5 stars. I suppose what I am saying is as good as this is after awhile lack of variability hurts it.
Excellent game, but there's currently a bug where I cannot place a tile in the top left corner of the board even when I should be able to.  Not sure where to submit this issue though.
Good game. Very quick. Then comes the scoring. Please provide an option to speed up the scoring!

I own the boardgame version of this game and love it, so I bought this to 
play it 'on the go', but so far it really bashed my expectations: 1. there 
is no way to turn of the animations (to save battery), 2. in-game controls 
are so tiny I can barely press them, 3. I don't get how to change the 
difficulty of the AI (it seems to jump randomly or not at all?!) 4. In 
landscape mode I can't see what the game missions are. Clicking them 
doesn't do anything unless I turn my screen to portrait. 5. Don't even try 
to play this on a device with a screen less than 7 inch. You'll hardly see 
the map with all the players info. 6. There is no 'back' option in-game?! 
So if you accidentally click on a cell, you *have* to build around that 
one. No option to replace it somewhere else!? I'm waiting for a new version 
or I'll ask my money back!

This was my favorite app. I stopped playing for a little while and got back 
to it: it has so many bugs! I can't finish games! For instance the AI has 2 
tiles left but only plays one. That's not even allowed in the rules. Then I 
can't use any special tiles! Please fix this game, at least undo the last 
update. It's not possible to play anymore!

It's a decent implementation of a great board game. The interface is not 
great for mobile though, and it really needs an undo button: you can zoom 
and immediately place where you don't want to.
The game is broken i cant place any tokens in the corners example being i got a forrest card the only forrest i could play on was the corner space so i couldn't finish the game
Sometimes building next to a city the first time doesn't get you a tile. Sometimes you do get the tile but can't use from your part of the screen. App was better before last update.
Was a five star app but with the new update that automatically switches it to landscape and splits the players onto two sides it is much worse now.
Latest update made the game unplayable on pixel xl
Lastest patch seems to have broke game. Unplayable now.

I just got the latest update which took 3 years to come out so you would expect it to be tested. . Now it defaults to landscape mode and doesn't scale correctly if  you try to play portrait.  They say they fixed some bugs but they made it much worse in my opinion.  The graphics are too small in landscape mode and I'm running on a Nexus 9. . I'd hate to see it on a phone. . Sad since I love the actual board game.

I enjoy kingdom builder but this app is not great. I can't sign in to play multiplayer because no matter how many times I click the box a keyboard never appears. I also have a hard time with single player because the A.I. keeps freezing on their turn. Was hoping for so much more
Would be 5 stars if they had an undo button.  Also, hoping for some expansions.
Boring. Not worth 3$. I played less then 10 min. And want a refund.

I really am just reviewing this seeing that the last update was in 2014. Reading reviews it seems like there are a lot of bugs still and they haven't done anything about it. Just bought the game but might refund it because it seems like they aren't going to be updating it anytime soon
It's the game on your phone, plays well, AI is strong, ideal
The Kingdom Builder board game? Awesome. The android app? FIX THE BUGS, already.

On galaxy s6. Buttons are so small they are impossible to click. It's difficult to drag down the cards awarding points. Too much space for  settlement count while the board is not big enough. The online option seems to be impossible to use.  Probably better to be played at a tablet than a phone. Shame as I owe the board game and played it a lot.

I'm a big fan of Kingdom Builder but this game is buggy! It won't let me click on the missions for reminders of what the scoring objectives are, and some of the building powers will fail to refresh for use. The iOS app works perfectly, which is a shame because I prefer to play on my Samsung tablet. With a proper fix, I'd give it 5 out of 5.

Too many crashes. :-( Not worth the money, although being a big Kingdom builder fan. And a bug. On the rop left corner the field cannot be used with a tower or a regular card move. If that is the last available field, no turn possible anymore.

This is a rating of the APP, not the game.     Kingdom Builder is a great game, but considering the competition, this app feels very behind the times. The good: The AI is great! The bad: The user interface is clunky to use and doesn't look very polished. It's difficult to swipe down the Kingdom Cards because they're up at the very top of the screen, where you also have to swipe down for your settings on an Android phone. There is also a comically tiny "close window" button up there, that can also be hard to tap. Then, when the "score" window comes up, it's even worse.  An "undo" button should be added, for if you accidentally tap the wrong hex (which is easy to do while zooming in/out, which you have to do constantly.) In a throwback to the days of NES, there doesn't appear to be a way to "save" your game and return to it later, if the app shuts down for any reason. The multiplayer feature is poorly documented.     That said, I'll keep the app and continue to play it, because I like the game and the app is at least usable. But if you play something like Race for the Galaxy (which is a dream app) and then switch over to this, the difference in quality is sadly stark.

Would be a good port except for the bug & no dev support for almost 2 years. Example: if you try to place a piece in the top left corner, the game won't place a piece & you can then be stuck with the game trying to make you place a piece that it won't let you place.
Great game!
Game need an undo button. Because the screen is so small I have trouble selecting the areas I want or sometimes will click the wrong bonus action and I can't go back to deselect it.

I started playing KB as a board game. I love how the mechanic is but it seems to me that it requires lots of luck on how I draw a terrain card. But playing with AI makes me understand the game more strategically. Great game. I loaded this game on both my iPad and my Sumsung Tab.
I like the app. I like the game. However it is unstable on my galaxy. I get a lot of crashes.
The implementation is GREAT, could you just please add some of the expansions just to have more winning conditions, most people will be glad to pay for them

This is surely a fun game. However it is clearly designed for a tablet because all map graphics are tiny, card writing is illegible until you zoom in, top bar to see cards is super thin, and buttons are tiny. However half the screen is dedicated to just tracking the scores even in landscape mode. Do this implementation  a favour. Check out small world 2's interface for score tracking. That is much nicer. I want the map to fill the screen (enforce landscape mode on non-tablets). I want the cards to be accessible by a scroll on the side of the screen. I want markers and scores tracked using a small portion of the screen. These changes would make the game much less frustrating to play on a phone. Also the wood effect and avatars are a bit boring.
Needs the expansion packs!!!!!
Bad implementation of a good board game. Needs undo button.

Functional, but some UI problems. Can't always drop houses in the upper left corner on a smartphone. If you leave it minimized for awhile, sometimes the UI shows skill tiles in strange places. Easy to misclick placements, and there is no undo.
Great

I'm a big fan of the KB game, but the app is lacking in a lot of areas. The Good: App is playable; AI is decent; and KB has a lot of replay value. The Bad: UI components are horribly scaled on phone and barely clickable; a few UI controls aren't intuitive; settings aren't saved between sessions (causing blaring sound on occasion); and new player experience is painful. Overall feels like a rushed app for a great game. All that said, I felt like it was worth the $.99 I got it for but definitely not full price
Good adaptation of a great board game. However, I wish it added some extra features as mobile adaptations of board games sometimes do.

A good rendition of the board game but seriously needs an oops button. Accidentally playing a piece when you are only trying to zoom is frustrating. A preview mode for some of the specialty plays like the jump a settlement tile would be helpful. Playing with only the base objectives does get boring pretty quickly.
Feel daft as its so confusing atm
Good game Yo
Great

Generally a good version of the board game, and worth the $0.99 I paid.  Why only 4 stars? I like to look at the board before playing my first piece, but it's too easy to accidentally play a piece while doing so, thus locking me into a part of the board I didn't want to be.  Why can't they just add an Undo button?
Even though I have a 10" tablet, I have great difficulty reading the text on the  screen.
Excellent only bug can't use top left hex
The puddle I make when I piss is deeper than this game. The app is fine, works great. But my god is this game boring. ..

I really like the board game so I got this to use as a travel edition. Whilst it's OK and we will continue to play it, a couple of really basic things let it down; no save game state, no undo step prior to committing move, finicky UI... Most irritating though are the occasions where the game gets stuck, usually using a location tile where the only option is to quit the game and start over. I notice it hasn't been updated in two years so not holding my breath for fixes.

No undo which is awful on a small interface. The victory conditions are unreadable so you can't reference them to develope a strategy. The zoom is very glitchy. Overall the GUI isn't usable on a mobile device.
Have lost count of the number of games that have crashed or hung. Buggy trash that the developers can't be bothered with.
Love this game.
There is simply no excuse for having no undo button !!! This is such a small UI and its so easy to click the wrong thing.

I love this game! I only have a few minor issues with it. (1) It doesn't remember my sound settings when I exit, so I have to keep turning the sound off every time I open the game, (2) there is no "undo" option if you accidentally click in the wrong hex and drop a settlement there, (3)  the game will not allow me to click on the top-left settlement to use one of the move functions. I can choose any other settlement on the board, but not the top left one. Other than these quirks, it's great!

Sometimes on the last move the AI doesn't seem to have placed all his settlements,  resulting in an extra turn, however on my turn it doesn't allow me to use any of the powers yet I have to place huts, then wait for another go before I can move them around. ie AI started game, and has 1 settlement left to place. He has his go,  shuffles a bit and still has one left to place when it becomes my turn. I place three settlements bit can't do any shuffling. Then we each have an extra go.

The board game is fantastic, but this is a decent android version of it with awesome AI gameplay but a lot of in game bugs like vanishing location tiles and the last turn sometimes gets skipped unlike the board game where you can play an extra turn before the game ends otherwise this is an excellent game that pretty much copies the same game and all the mechanics . just some small bugs that ruin some parts of the game.

There are a lot of issues with the UI, for example it's hard to select the different goals to check them, no undo button if you accidentally place a settlement, some zoom and panning issues as well. Too bad the last update was in early 2014..
Undo button should be implemented.  :(
Game worked for like six games then stopped and won't let me play any more
Cannot see the descriptions on the scoring cards, so cannot implement any kind of strategy
This is an okay game with a passable implementation. No frills here. Only buy if you love the board game.
Great game, but the bugs give it two stars. I cannot get through a game without it shutting down the game or my tablet. 5 stars if it gets fixed.

I wasn't sure if this would be a game I would like. I figured I would check it out with the digital version. I love the challenge of each game with all the different scoring goals. I definitely want to add the table top version to my collection.
Poor implementation. Cannot even select text field to register, and you must register to play online. The rest seems clunky, but hard to say when you can't play it

As a KB fan, I give it a thumb up. The interface is ok, and the AI challenging. The only thing that is missing is any word on expansions. Here's hoping that the sales will be good enough for them to happen soon. And that the pricing won't be ridcolous like that of Dominion. Anyway, so far, good job. Would be 5 stars if you had a fair priced expansions.
In today's day and age, the inability of a game app to be moved to the SD card is poor (or lazy) coding. Fix this please.
Yes just OK.  The app itself doesn't explain the game very well, and it doesn't contain any instructions, just a tutorial.  The game itself in just OK.  Less fun than Catan by a long shot.
The menu buttons are tiny on the LG G3 screen due to its high resolution. It makes it so difficult to consult the three condition cards on the top as well.
Seriously, who approved this?
The buttons are impossibly small to hit. Completely unplayable on the Nexus 5. Be warned!
Great game, however the gameboard and settings don't function properly on my NVidia Shield tablet. Thankfully works fine on my HTC One though!

Really functional app to play the game. Don't let other reviews fool you it plays the game well and lack of undo didn't bother me too much. Plays well on my Droid Turbo. For six bucks though I'd like to see the app be a little more polished and more stylish. For example to zoom out of the map I have to rotate my device. It's little things that would make this a better app. Very good for getting your Kingdom Builder fix like I needed today though.
I never played the physical version of this game. Found it online. I like it! Thing is, board gets boring after a while. Are there no other configurations?
Great game... "Undo Last Placement" would be helpful when tablets can be overly sensitive.  Hope to see Expansion options added.
No back button and you can't get any expansion so it gets boring
I'm not a fan of the board game, but the app does ease out all the fiddlyness of the original. It's a good game to pass a bit of time.

It's a really nice game, I agree with others that an undo button is necessary, but what bothers me is the constant crashing. For what it's worth, it's loads of fun with a smart AI and highly variable outcomes by design.

Very nice addictive boardgame, with small problems.  1. The UNDO is missing. There is no hidden information during a single turn so at least I should be able to restart my current turn.  2. It is pretty tricky to place a building in the top left corner. Because of a disturbing bug you have to click on the topleft cell many times, because usually a building description shows up, instead of a successful placement. 3. After about thousands games I'm tired of counting settlements for the Lord.

Fun game, but it has one bug that usually doesn't matter but sometimes ruins everything.  Often, (possibly always) for whatever reason, the game will refuse to place a building on the top left hex (that is, player one's corner), while still registering it as a valid place to do so.  I'm sure the reason why this is sometimes a disaster should be obvious if you know the game's rules.
...on a nexus5. Too bad, great game

Update: game unplayable on Nexus 9. Crashes every time I try to play. // This game is pretty much perfect. Just wish there was a way to pick up a piece if you clicked somewhere by accident. Maybe there is a way and I just didn't notice. Either way, 5 stars.

There are three major mechanic bugs in the game right now. 1. Settlements on water spaces adjacent to other water spaces do not count as adjacent for fisherman points. 2. The game often ends before all opponents have their last turn, or sometimes allows for a second round after a player places their last piece. 3. Occasionally the game will not allow the player to use their tile actions even though there is a valid move on the board. Also, this may be just me, but the medium Ai seems harder than the hard ai

I would like option to move my pieces around so I can plan on my move visually. I would also love to play the expansions on this app. Finally, I'd like to be able to set up a game with my friends via private network so we don't have to continue playing hot potato with the mobile. Great game.
Game play is great. Like others have said, you need to include an undo button. Also, can't figure out how to register for online gameplay. Once these issues are addressed, 5 stars it is!
It's a hair difficult to learn the game with the awful translations and poor tutorial. It also occasionally crashes. I'll probably play it more.
Tiles disaapear

The game functions perfectly. However I downloaded without ever playing the board game. I just don't find the game itself interesting at all. I've played a dozen times. Just don't see how it won awards. There are other euro board games that I find much more enjoyable and interesting to play. Just my opinion, obviously.

I really like the board game and am glad to see it on Android but this implementation is really missing some basic features. As others have mentioned you can't undo a placement which is really annoying. The UI for text and buttons was also designed with small resolutions in mind, meaning it comes off as rather clunky on my 10" tablet. At the end of a game it slowly counts through all the points, with no option to skip through. You also can't change the sound option mid-game.  So high marks for the game itself (that is, the board game itself) but low marks for the thoughtless implementation.

This game would be perfect were it not for a few flaws that make it annoying. Firstly,  there is a bug that sometimes causes at least one of my collected location tiles to vanish. Secondly, the game will not allow me to register,  so I am unable to enjoy online play. Thirdly,  there are no audio options, so I am forced to mute my phone if I want to play without disturbing anyone else. And lastly, like many others here have said, there really needs to be an "undo" feature.
Needs an undo button, especially for phone users, what with the itty bitty buttons and all.  Also,  I NEED the expansions! Will GLADLY pay!
After collecting a special action, they will vanish at various times for human players. AI opponents never lose their actions which makes it nearly impossible to ever win.

Loved the board game and the app is a great way to practice but it's buggy.  The UI to do online play doesn't work... I see a form to register for online play, but then the fields do nothing when I tap them, so I can't even enter the username and password to continue.  I wish it would persist sound and AI settings.  An undo button too.  Last, I've noticed that if the upper left corner tile is the only place I can put a new settlement it won't let me play there; I have to forfeit the game and start over.
Can you persist the games even if the app is closed? Sometimes I start using other apps, and when I go back to Kingdom Builder my game is gone.
Great implementation of a fun game. A bit deeper than Carcassonne, but still easy to learn with fast play. Wish piece placement could be undone, but otherwise fantastic.

Runs slowly and sometimes stops completely, requiring a restart. Crashes a lot too. On top of that some of the artwork doesn't scale so on my new phone some buttons are invisibly small. Overall a pretty half-assed implementation.
A good game properly set up. Using a  Samsung Note 10.1 has shown two recurring minor problems.

A decent port of a game which both intrigues and annoys me. Some bugs though: you can't place in the top left space (which has led to unfinishable games when it was the  only legal move) also settlements on AND adjacent to water should score for Fishermen but don't.

This is a really good game of worker placement and variable goals. Having to think of a different strategy in every game gives a lot of replayability. There are a few bugs, for example I find I can't place  a piece in the top left corner (trying to instead brings up the information for the harbour!) Nethertheless I recommend this. The AI is pretty good too.

I been playing off and on for a few months now, enjoy the game a lot, the AI is challenging but beatable so far. I only found one bug with trying to placing a tile in the top left, only valid move and could not place, so had to restart game. Happened once of about 20 games so far. A setting option for confirmation of placement would be nice.

Love the game, but this is very poorly done. Lots of ui bugs making it hard to click anywhere. Feels like they only tested on one device and weren't very careful about supporting different screen sizes.  I was excited to see there's online play,but I can't get it to register and account. Bummer.
I play this on my phone while waiting for the game group to arrive.

There seems to be a bug when you place using the pillar power.  If this is done first other special tile abilities get forfeited.  Placing in the upper most left hand corner.. BAD. Sometimes the special tiles get hidden from view for some reason.  Next, I wish it would remember my volume settings.  Volume keeps reseting when I go back to it.  The AI settings do the same.  Persistent memory seems broken for these settings.   Those aside I have enjoyed playing it and I have been able to get my moneys worth.
Needs undo button and expansions.
Love this game. Works great. One of my favorites on android. Would love to see the Nomads and Crossroads game expansions added!
Thought this was a great version of the board game. And Ai is not too bad.
Graphics a bit shoddy in an otherwise great game.
Finally some decent boardgames are coming to Android

I've enjoyed the physical incarnation of Kingdom Builder since we picked it up in a spectacular deal a while back. It's a great abstract game that I find challenging and entertaining with each play.  This Android implementation is very true to the original. The medium and hard AI opponents offer quite a bit of challenge.  The only things that would make this game a solid five would be the ability to leave and resume games, asynchronous multiplayer game play and the ability to do friend matching.

This is a very good implementation of the boardgame, with a few issues: 1) No UNDO, as many have mentioned; 2) The graphics are fairly low-res, so reading the Kingdom cards' details is pretty much impossible; 3) If you click on a Kingdom card to view it, then want to view a different Kingdom card, it won't let you (not that you can read it anyway!). Other than that, it's a great implementation. Showing the possible places a piece can be placed in is great, and having it score for you is SO nice.

Excellent game and good reproduction of board game. However, can't give it 5 stars as there is no Undo function which is indispensable considering how easy it is to misplace a piece on the board. It would also be better to highlight clearly how many tokens are left on each city especially when playing with more than 2 players.
Great game, well made now bring us the expansions please.
My only quibble would be the ability to undo an accidental move. Otherwise a very entertaining game.
It definitely needs a selective undo, you shouldn't be able to undo all the time but there are many times I need it for clicking accidents.

A good implementation, but needs an undo as it is easy to miss click especially when zooming.  The recent bug fixes make it a smoother experience.  Add a one step undo and add the expansions to make it amazing.  :-)
Great when it works but crashes frequently

This game has transferred to electronic media fantastically. It's a brilliant game with endless playability as each game is different due to different objectives and board game tiles. As others have stated an undo button wouldn't go amiss. All in all a very good game for android and the lack of an undo button doesn't cost it a star.
Bad glitches on more than one device. Needs a glossary and better rules and insstructions. Not as good as settlers of Catan but fun.
Needs some interface improvements, undo for example. Screen transitions are not needed.
The UI is nice, but needs some features like undo.  Also, the upper left corner is almost impossible to select.
Pretty good, the only thing that would be nice is that tje game would "remember" settings like mute and AI setup.
Looks nice but no undo and no reference to the scoring cards make it hard to play. Not even a manual. Only way to check scoring cards is to go through the tutorial again.

I was a little worried at first looking at the opening menu transitions because they're a bit odd (clunky even; why do they alway fade in from the same side? seems like there was an oversight there), but once I got into a game I was happy. There could be a better way to select AI opponents for smaller screens than swiping.  I'm in complete agreement with everyone else about the need for an undo. Errant clicks are one concern. It's also impossible to select a piece and look at its available movement options (if I'm using a movement ability) without already being committed to moving that piece.
The ai is poor, it operates with pure cheating with the draws. The ui is slow on a dualcore moto razr. Settings are annoying. No undo during your own turn.
Nice implimentation
An undo button would be nice, but the AI following the rules would be better. Usually on the first turn, sometimes on 2nd and 3rd, the AI will only place 1 building. Why does the AI get to cheat?
This is very well done and plays well on my phone.  Tutorial is helpful and easy to follow.  Undo button would be nice as well as making the rules available mid game. Well worth the purchase.
But can lose game progress when app loses focus.
Needs undo.

This is a great version of the board game.  The interface is polished without being too flashy.  I find it easy to play on my phone, particularly since the zoom function is so well implemented.  I would like for the icons representing the scoring cards to be a little bigger, since they can be hard to tap on using a phone screen.  However, overall this is a very enjoyable port of a very fun game.  More like this please!
Great to see Queen games releasing digital versions of their board games on Android. This is a very good implementation, easy zooming,  quick tutorial. Easy to see what is going on.
